alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Atlantic, eastern Cumberland, southeastern Gloucester and northwestern Cape May Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near South Vineland to near Millville to Mauricetown. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Millville, Cumberland, Buena, Laurel Lake, Woodbine, Estell Manor, Newfield, Corbin City, Mauricetown, Belleplain Forest, Leesburg, Port Norris, Dividing Creek, Dorothy, Bricksboro, Mizpah, Port Elizabeth, Bivalve and South Vineland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern New Jersey. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.
